intro: Oreocarya celosioides, commonly known as the Sierra madre dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped, while its flowers are yellow and bloom in spring. Oreocarya celosioides is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
